script:
AddText "One of the crewmembers aboard the shuttle with you note that several prominently placed, futuristic billboards starkly contrast with the decidely archaiac  architecture of several buildings you've seen as your shuttle makes it's way to the landing zone. When ArmaA gained rights to administer this colony, it seems to have produced a peculiar melting pot of consumerism in excess with the more subdued and traditional sensibilities of the colonies original denizens. As if on cue, two security officers in bizzarely ornate power armor meander into view, ostensibly to deal with some kind of ruckus." marketFlavorTextColor
AddText "The haze of pollution hangs thick above you, but the people here seem to be getting along well enough - or at least what qualifies as 'well enough' in the Sector, these days." marketFlavorTextColor

text:
A featureless armored faceplate stares back at you. 

"Ah, hello there! Are you in need of the skills of mercenaries with -real- talent?"

Much like your last encounter, the faceplate of the $nex_mercRank greets you. This time, however, $nex_mercHisOrHer voice cuts the silence first.

"I have no business with you."

"Affirmative. Let me gather my things."

A small band of warcraft join up with your $shipOrFleet a short period later.

"It's been....a pleasure. Farewell."

You accept $hisOrHer decision professionally and, after exchanging a few pleasantries, cut the comm link.
I don't do charity work, Commander. Find me when your finances are in order.
Crimson allows you to finish your tirade. There is a brief silence before they chuckle creepily, cutting the comm.

The $personRank stares at you, faceplate masking their true reaction.

"Word about people like you spreads fast, $playerName. I'll see you very soon..heh heh heh."

The comm link is cut before you have a chance to respond.

text: The battered mech drifts near your $shipOrFleet, Bizzarely, it appears to be in relatively good condition. Such a small vessel usually wouldn't be worth investigating, but the sensor pings are akin to that of a fully fledged frigate, indicating what could be something unusual. Your tactical officer brings your attention to it's unsecured cockpit, as if the 'mech was hastily abandoned.

A small salvage team is deployed, almost immediately finding what's left of the pilot. He is quite deceased, and has been for some time.

The dispatched crew what they can of value from the derelict. The law of salvage rules, even here.
